messages.content: What is the purpose of the sd-dynamic-thresholding extension?
The sd-dynamic-thresholding extension enables the use of higher CFG Scales without color issues in Stable Diffusion by clamping latents between steps.
Which GUIs is the sd-dynamic-thresholding extension compatible with?
The sd-dynamic-thresholding extension is compatible with SwarmUI, ComfyUI, and AUTOMATIC1111 Stable Diffusion WebUI.
Who originally developed the core functionality of sd-dynamic-thresholding?
The core functionality of sd-dynamic-thresholding was originally developed by Birch-san.
How can the sd-dynamic-thresholding extension be installed in the Auto WebUI?

In the Auto WebUI, the sd-dynamic-thresholding extension can be installed either by loading it from the 'Available' tab in the 'Extensions' section or by installing it from the URL 'https://github.com/mcmonkeyprojects/sd-dynamic-thresholding'.
How can the sd-dynamic-thresholding extension be used in ComfyUI?

In ComfyUI, the sd-dynamic-thresholding extension can be used by cloning the repository into the 'ComfyUI/custom_nodes' directory, restarting ComfyUI, adding the node 'advanced/mcmonkey/DynamicThresholdingSimple' (or 'Full'), linking the model to the input, and linking the output model to the KSampler's input.
Is the sd-dynamic-thresholding extension compatible with custom variants of the KSampler node in ComfyUI?

Yes, the sd-dynamic-thresholding extension is compatible with any variant of the KSampler node in ComfyUI, including custom ones, as long as they do not totally override the internal sampling function.
What is the license under which sd-dynamic-thresholding is distributed?

The sd-dynamic-thresholding extension is distributed under the MIT License, which allows for free use, copying, modification, merging, publishing, distribution, sublicensing, and selling of the software, subject to certain conditions such as including the copyright notice and permission notice in all copies or substantial portions of the software.
